verses.text: So they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.
And when David had made an end of offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*.
And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine.
¶ And he appointed certainof the Levites to minister before the ark of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, and to record, and to thank and praise the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*God of Israel:

Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-edom: and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps; but Asaph made a sound with cymbals;
Benaiah also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
¶ Then on that day David delivered first this psalmto thank the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*into the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
Give thanks unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, call upon his name, make known his deeds among the people.
Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him, talk ye of all his wondrous works.
Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*.
Seek the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*and his strength, seek his face continually.
Remember his marvellous works that he hath done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
O ye seed of Israel his servant, ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
He isthe \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*our God; his judgments arein all the earth.
Be ye mindful always of his covenant; the word whichhe commanded to a thousand generations;
Even of the covenantwhich he made with Abraham, and of his oath unto Isaac;
And hath confirmed the same to Jacob for a law, andto Israel foran everlasting covenant,
Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance;
When ye were but few, even a few, and strangers in it.
And whenthey went from nation to nation, and from onekingdom to another people;
He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
Sing unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, all the earth; shew forth from day to day his salvation.
Declare his glory among the heathen; his marvellous works among all nations.
For great isthe \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, and greatly to be praised: he also isto be feared above all gods.
For all the gods of the people areidols: but the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*made the heavens.
Glory and honour arein his presence; strength and gladness arein his place.
Give unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, ye kindreds of the people, give unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*glory and strength.
Give unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*the glory dueunto his name: bring an offering, and come before him: worship the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*in the beauty of holiness.
Fear before him, all the earth: the world also shall be stable, that it be not moved.
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice: and let mensay among the nations, The \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*reigneth.
Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof: let the fields rejoice, and all that istherein.
Then shall the trees of the wood sing out at the presence of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, because he cometh to judge the earth.
O give thanks unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*; for he isgood; for his mercy endurethfor ever.
And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us together, and deliver us from the heathen, that we may give thanks to thy holy name, andglory in thy praise.
Blessed bethe \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*God of Israel for ever and ever. And all the people said, Amen, and praised the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*.
¶ So he left there before the ark of the covenant of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s work required:
And Obed-edom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to beporters:
And Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*in the high place that wasat Gibeon,

To offer burnt offerings unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*upon the altar of the burnt offering continually morning and evening, and to doaccording to all that is written in the law of the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, which he commanded Israel;
And with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*, because his mercy endurethfor ever;
And with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun wereporters.
And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
